result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen T Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

sentencing - January 12, 2015 - A Klein
Defendant Allen T Murphy in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
From defendant's mother, Christine Murphy - Exparte Communication - scanned and forwarded to Br. 2 clerk
Sentencing hearing on January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen T Murphy in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of no contest.   Court accepts plea, finds the defendant guilty. Defense requests adjournment for sentencing. State will ask for 2 yrs total; 1 yr confinement, 1 yr extended supervision, no contact with victim.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen T Murphy in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Defendant Allen T Murphy in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Waive reading of felony complaint. Defendant qualifies for public defender,will appoint counsel.  State requests cash bail with conditions.   Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
